comments:
This is the steps I make:

- create an ecore file - My.ecore. The model object is EPackage. The encoding is
UTF-8. The name of the package is "My". 
- create a new class in the "My" package- MyClass1.
- crete a EMF model - My.genmodel using the My.ecore model.
- enter the My.ecore file and create a new class - MyClass2.
- click on the My.genmodel file with the right button and then click on the
Reload.. action.
- chose to reload from an Ecore model. 
- click Next.
- and the following error occures:

Please attach the .ecore you used.  It sounds like you likely have an EPackage
without an nsURI set, since you didn't describe setting that in your steps.  If
that's the case, I'll return it as a duplicate of
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=75933 and/or
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=104727.

I am really sorry. I havent set the nsURI.
My mistake.
Sorry again.

Kiril,

There's no need to apologize.  We really should handle errors like this better
and should inform you so you can fix it, rather than just failing.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 75933 ***
